meanings.definition: To make a hole or opening with a gimlet.
meanings.sent1: She was gimleting the wood to hang a picture.
meanings.sent2: He gimleted the cork to open the bottle.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter was gimleting so fast, he almost flew away!
meanings.sent4: Her words gimleted through his heart, leaving a lasting mark.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the gimleting echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: To pierce or penetrate with a gimlet.
meanings.sent1: The chef was gimleting the lemon for garnish.
meanings.sent2: The explorer gimleted through the thick jungle with ease.
meanings.sent3: The idea of gimleting a hole in the air made him chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze gimleted through the crowd, searching for him.
meanings.sent5: The arrow gimleted through the target with precision.

meanings.definition: Having the shape or characteristics of a gimlet.
meanings.sent1: The gimleting tool had a sharp point for drilling.
meanings.sent2: The gimleting design of the bottle opener made it easy to use.
meanings.sent3: The cat's eyes had a gimleting intensity when hunting.
meanings.sent4: His words had a gimleting effect on her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The tree had a gimleting twist in its trunk.
